title: Exploiting Explicit Paths for Multi-hop Reading Comprehension
author: Souvik Kundu
Tushar Khot
Ashish Sabharwal
abstract:
We focus on the task of multi-hop reading comprehension where a system is
required to reason over a chain of multiple facts, distributed across multiple
passages, to answer a question. Inspired by graph-based reasoning, we present a
path-based reasoning approach for textual reading comprehension. It operates by
generating potential paths across multiple passages, extracting implicit
relations along this path, and composing them to encode each path. The proposed
model achieves a 2.3% gain on the WikiHop Dev set as compared to previous
state-of-the-art and, as a side-effect, is also able to explain its reasoning
through explicit paths of sentences.
